docs.snippet: A group is determined to make sure nobody forgets that French is one of the Olympics’ two official languages, along with English....
docs.lead_paragraph: A group is determined to make sure nobody forgets that French is one of the Olympics’ two official languages, along with English.
docs.abstract: French language is scarcely used at Rio Olympics, despite its designation in Olympic charter as one of two official languages for Games; International Organization of la Francophonie faces uphill battle in monitoring and advocating for use of language, especially when Games are held in non-French-speaking countries.

headline.main: Brazilians Speak Portuguese, but the Olympics Must Use French
headline.print_headline: Brazilians Speak Portuguese,  but Games Are Tied to French

byline.contributor: Victor Mather and Sam Dolnick contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: It is one of Rio's most renowned favelas, the Cidade de Deus made infamous in a film that helped cement a stereotype of the other side of the "Marvelous City" that is host of the Olympic Games — one where ghettos are ruled by drug lords and ...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is one of Rio's most renowned favelas, the Cidade de Deus made infamous in a film that helped cement a stereotype of the other side of the "Marvelous City" that is host of the Olympic Games — one where ghettos are ruled by drug lords and baby-faced criminals shoot to kill.

docs.snippet: The killings, one in Massachusetts and the other in Queens, have put many female runners on edge, and some no longer feel comfortable jogging alone....
docs.lead_paragraph: The killings, one in Massachusetts and the other in Queens, have put many female runners on edge, and some no longer feel comfortable jogging alone.
docs.abstract: Murders of joggers Vanessa Marcotte and Karina Betrano in Princeton, Mass, and borough of Queens in New York City have unnerved many female runners and prompted them to rethink their routes.

headline.main: ‘It Absolutely Has Created Fear’: 2 Killings Prompt Female Joggers to Alter Routines
headline.print_headline: Female Joggers Rethink Their Routines After Killings in 2 States
